content.description: A couple of sit starts exist on the left face as you approach the boulder.  This face is also the main downclimb off the boulder.
content.location: It is on the left side as you approach.

content.description: Start sitting on the blocky hold as for Child's Play, make one move up, then trend right into the stand start of Thug. This really takes the best moves of both Child's Play and Thug.
content.protection: Several pads to manage the rock in the landing zone.
content.location: This is in the middle of the tall, steep face.

content.description: Start on small undercling and crimp on right. Fire a big dead point to the horizontal (small crimps) two left hand side pull flakes lead to the v at the top.
content.location: It is on the back side of Ames Boulder, in the very center of the wall.

content.description: To the left of the crack in the big slab are several different variations to get up the slab.
content.location: These on the the big slab as you approach the boulder.

content.description: Climb the big, tall crack in the slab.
content.location: It is the obvious crack in the slab as you walk up to the boulder.

content.description: Sit start the prow to the right of Crazy Girls and left of a big crack.
content.location: It is on the back side of the boulder.

content.description: Start about 5 feet right of Thug on a part of the face that juts out a bit.  Climb up on good holds to a high topout.
content.location: It is right of Thug and left of the corner that Crazy Girls climbs.

content.description: This problem starts on two right-facing sidepulls. Bump up left then out right to huge left-facing sidepull. Layback and make big move to end of flared crack up right then left up crack to topout.
content.location: It is to the right of Good Aim on Ames Boulder. This boulder can be found off Boulder Trail near Ames mansion.

content.description:
Start on the face/arête left of Thug, and climb up to the high topout. 

Edit: it is the face just to the right of the arête but left of Thug. Moving left to the arête and into the corner system makes it much easier.
content.location: This climbs the left edge/arête of the Thug face.

content.description: Sit start at arête to the right of the slab, make one or two moves on the overhang, then finish up the high slab right of the crack.
content.location: It is right of the crack and left of Child's Play.

content.description: Start sitting at slopey holds at small roof just left of the big slab. Make one hard move straight up, then move slightly left and over the jutting arête.
content.location: It is just left of the slab as you approach the boulder.

content.description: This huge granite boulder has about 12 problems. The only boulder actually shown on DCR's map of the park (see photo).
